title: Grammar and Punctuation Basics

vocab.definition: A word that names a person, place, or thing
A word that shows action or tells what someone does
A word that describes a noun
A word that describes a verb, telling how, when, or where
A group of words that tells a complete thought
A punctuation mark (.) that ends a sentence
A punctuation mark (?) that ends a question

teachingNotes: Use concrete examples to teach parts of speech. Practice identifying nouns, verbs, and adjectives in simple sentences. Emphasize proper sentence structure with capital letters and ending punctuation.

truefalse.question: A noun names a person, place, or thing.
A verb is a describing word.
A sentence must start with a capital letter.
All sentences end with a question mark.

multiplechoice.question: Which word is an adjective in this sentence: 'The big dog ran fast'?
